Constructor Detail

init

public init([any serviceName], [numeric maxConcurrent='0'], [numeric maxWorkQueueSize='10000'], [any objectFactory='[runtime expression]'])

Parameters:
serviceName - The unique application name for this Completion service
maxConcurrent - The maximum number of tasks which will be run at one time. A value of 0 will cause the maxConcurrent to be calculated as Number of CPUs + 1
maxWorkQueueSize - yes
objectFactory

execute

public any execute([any runnableTask])
Straight from the javadoc: Executes the given command at some time in the future. The command may execute in a new thread, in a pooled thread, or in the calling thread, at the discretion of the Executor implementation. This is the equivalent of fire-and-forget usage of cfthread

Parameters:
runnableTask - A task instance that exposes a void run() method

invokeAll

public any invokeAll([array tasks], [any timeout='0'], [any timeUnit='seconds'])
Executes the tasks, returning an array of Futures when all complete. If the service is not running, tasks are ignored.

Parameters:
tasks - An array of task instances. A task CFC must expose a call() method that returns a result
timeout - Maximum time to wait. 0 indicates to wait until completion
timeUnit - TimeUnit of the timeout argument, as a string. Defaults to "seconds".

invokeAny

public any invokeAny([array tasks], [any timeout='0'], [any timeUnit='seconds'])
Executes the tasks, returning the result of one that has completed successfully, if any do. This result will be the returned value from the task's call() method If the service is not running, tasks are ignored.

Parameters:
tasks - An array of task instances. A task CFC must expose a call() method that returns a result
timeout - Maximum time to wait. 0 indicates to wait until completion
timeUnit - TimeUnit of the timeout argument, as a string. Defaults to "seconds".

start

public any start()

Overrides:
start in class AbstractExecutorService
